DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study design explore optimal concentration method Ginkgolides Meglumine Injection skin test evaluate value skin test predict possible allergic reaction Ginkgolides Meglumine Injection .
DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Study Ginkgolides Meglumine Injection Skin Testing .
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects enrol one three group different dos receive skin prick test . Then may arrange receive intradermal , subcutaneous injection intravenous test different dos .
DOC.criteria: Male female age 18 70 ( inclusive ) time sign Informed Consent Form （ICF） . Subjects meet one follow requirement No history use dug contain bilobalide , Ginkgolide A , Ginkgolide B , Ginkgolide K ( include Ginkgolides Meglumine Injection ) . History use dug contain bilobalide , Ginkgolide A , Ginkgolide B , Ginkgolide K ( include Ginkgolides Meglumine Injection ) , allergy . History allergy dug contain bilobalide , Ginkgolide A , Ginkgolide B , Ginkgolide K ( include Ginkgolides Meglumine Injection ) . History allergy drug . Willingness participate study evidence sign informed consent form . Women breastfeed , menstrual pregnancy period . Subjects infectious disease , eczema , dermatitis , trauma , etc . Subjects meet one follow condition Used βblockers within 2 day prior start study . Used H1 antihistamine , imipramine , phenothiazine , Beta adrenaline etc . within 1 week prior start study . Used shortacting glucocorticoid drug within 1 week prior start study . Topical use glucocorticoid drug within 2 week prior start study . Used longacting glucocorticoid drug within 4 week prior start study Subjects currently participate participate clinical trial within prior 1 month signing ICF . Subjects history allergic shock . Subjects suitable clinical trial discretion investigator .
